channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: MTV made it big with music videos. Where does it stand today?
item.description: A reflection on music videos' glory days -- as MTV shuts down channels.
item.content:encoded: A reflection on music videos' glory days -- as MTV shuts down channels.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: In Mt. Olive, N.C., a ball doesn't drop for New Year's â€” a giant pickle does
item.description: Across the country, cities and towns have New Year's Eve drops that feature everything from New York City's crystal ball to a favorite product made by the people of Mt. Olive, North Carolina.
item.content:encoded: Across the country, cities and towns have New Year's Eve drops that feature everything from New York City's crystal ball to a favorite product made by the people of Mt. Olive, North Carolina.
item.dc:creator: Nick de la Canal

item.title: The state of the U.S. economy as 2025 draws to a close
item.description: The U.S. economy chugs into the new year in stronger shape than many forecasters had expected. But Americans remain wary about the high cost of living.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. economy chugs into the new year in stronger shape than many forecasters had expected. But Americans remain wary about the high cost of living.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump just vetoed 2 bills that had passed Congress with broad bipartisan support
item.description: President Trump issues his first vetoes of his second term.
item.content:encoded: President Trump issues his first vetoes of his second term.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: A solution to homelessness in Phoenix seems successful, but funding is running out
item.description: Downtown Phoenix businesses sued the city over a sprawling homeless encampment. The city's solution appears successful two years later, but funding for it is set to run out.
item.content:encoded: Downtown Phoenix businesses sued the city over a sprawling homeless encampment. The city's solution appears successful two years later, but funding for it is set to run out.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Davis-Young

item.title: New Orleans on alert as it marks one year since the New Year's Day attack
item.description: Extra security will be in place tonight in New Orleans as the city marks the anniversary of last year's New Year's Day attack. Drew Hawkins of the Gulf States Newsroom reports.
item.content:encoded: Extra security will be in place tonight in New Orleans as the city marks the anniversary of last year's New Year's Day attack. Drew Hawkins of the Gulf States Newsroom reports.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins

item.title: Progress for women movie directors stalled in 2025
item.description: Only 8% of directors with movies in theaters in 2025 were women. That news comes from an annual study from USC Annenberg. It reveals a reversal of trends that were not great to begin with; in 2020, the best year for women directors on record, only 15% of movie directors were women.
item.content:encoded: Only 8% of directors with movies in theaters in 2025 were women. That news comes from an annual study from USC Annenberg. It reveals a reversal of trends that were not great to begin with; in 2020, the best year for women directors on record, only 15% of movie directors were women.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Non-U.S. citizens will have to pay $100 surcharge to enter some national parks
item.description: Starting Jan. 1, non-U.S. citizens will have to pay an additional $100 each to enter 11 of America's most popular national parks.
item.content:encoded: Starting Jan. 1, non-U.S. citizens will have to pay an additional $100 each to enter 11 of America's most popular national parks.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohen

item.title: In a rare formal complaint, a federal judge is accused of bullying law clerks
item.description: A nonprofit group has filed a complaint alleging a federal judge has been bullying her law clerks. It's a flashpoint in the debate over whether the judiciary can police itself.
item.content:encoded: A nonprofit group has filed a complaint alleging a federal judge has been bullying her law clerks. It's a flashpoint in the debate over whether the judiciary can police itself.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: This new year celebration in Mumbai is just one of many in India
item.description: In Mumbai, some celebrate New Year's Eve with an effigy of the old year. It's just one of many New Years celebrated in India.
item.content:encoded: In Mumbai, some celebrate New Year's Eve with an effigy of the old year. It's just one of many New Years celebrated in India.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
